core.descr: The Loopback ID is associated with Internal Interface number which will be generated when we create a loopback.
This is external interface associated with internal interface of loopback. The Loopback ID is associated with Internal Interface number which will be generated when we create a loopback.
This is external interface associated with internal interface of loopback. The Loopback ID is associated with Internal Interface number which will be generated when we create a loopback.
The IP Address configured for the respective loopback
The Subnet mask configured for the respective loopback
Delete the IP Address configured for the respective loopback
Select Protocol (IPv4/IPv6) for a Loopback ID.
Check whether IPv4 is configured for the respective loopback

Status of this instance. The rows can be added/deleted in the table by setting createAndGo/destroy respectively active(1) - this loopback instance is active ;createAndGo(4) - set to this value to create an instance ; destroy(6) - set to this value to delete an instance
The Loopback ID is associated with Internal Interface number which will be generated when we create a loopback.
Loopback Address Index denotes the Loopback Interface Addresses.
The IP Address configured for the respective loopback
